etymology.description: 皁(皁) (zào, "acorn") is a variant traditional form of 皂(皂) (zào, "acorn") and a variant form of 早(早) (zǎo, "early"), retaining the original sense 'acorn.'
etymology.interpretation: 皁(皁) (zào, "acorn") is directly linked to 皂(皂) (zào, "acorn") and 早(早) (zǎo, "early") through shared historical forms. It illustrates how graph forms evolved while maintaining some of their original meanings.

examples.chinese: 秋天落叶时(秋天落葉時)，地上散落着许多皁(地上散落著許多皁)。
examples.pinyin: Qiūtiān luòyè shí, dìshàng sànluò zhe xǔduō zào.
examples.english: When autumn leaves fall, many acorns scatter on the ground.

examples.chinese: 树林边的小路上(樹林邊的小路上)，我看见了一只松鼠啃皁(我看見了一隻松鼠啃皁)。
examples.pinyin: Shùlín biān de xiǎolù shàng, wǒ kànjiàn le yī zhī sōngshǔ kěn zào.
examples.english: On the path by the woods, I saw a squirrel gnawing an acorn.

examples.chinese: 他把捡到的皁收入囊中(他把撿到的皁收入囊中)。
examples.pinyin: Tā bǎ jiǎndào de zào shōurù nángzhōng.
examples.english: He put the acorn he found into his pocket.
